description:
I have been uploading so many Iranian movies, people will think I've turned into an Ayatollah or something. Behold, a tribute to the courage and tenacity of the Israeli people!

Under the Domim Tree tells the story of various children who have suvived the holocaust, now they are at a residential school in Israel. The various things they have been through give them a sense of solidarity, but also mean hey have peculiarities of character that make getting along difficult.

I have had this one for years, thus it is ripped from tape and in segmented mpg format - it plays nicely on VLC.

PS My sympathy to TPB's Anakata, the $59 million man - it must be awesome to be worth that much! I wonder what Cambodia will do with the money.
